glossary.title: Glossary
glossary.subtitle: Key terms and concepts used in the PICO SulTeng COVID-19 API

reproductionRate.title: Reproduction Rate (Rt)
reproductionRate.definitionText: The effective reproduction number representing the average number of secondary infections caused by one infected individual at time t.
reproductionRate.growing: Epidemic is growing (each case infects >1 person)
reproductionRate.dataAvailabilityText: Values may be {nullCode} during the first 7 days or when there's insufficient data for reliable calculation.
reproductionRate.formulaDescription: The reproduction number Rt is estimated using Bayesian inference with the following key components:
formulaSteps: Calculate total infectiousness: λt = Σ(s=1 to t-1) I(t-s) × w(s)
Where I(t-s) = incidence at time (t-s), w(s) = serial interval probability
Posterior distribution: Rt|data ~ Gamma(a + Σ I(t), b + Σ λ(t))
Point estimate: E[Rt|data] = (a + Σ I(t)) / (b + Σ λ(t))

referenceList.title: Cori, A., Ferguson, N. M., Fraser, C., & Cauchemez, S. (2013)
referenceList.details: A new framework and software to estimate time-varying reproduction numbers during epidemics. 178(9), 1505-1512.

referenceList.title: Thompson, R. N., et al. (2019)
referenceList.details: Improved inference of time-varying reproduction numbers during infectious disease outbreaks. 29, 100356.

recovered.title: Recovered Cases
recovered.description: Patients who have recovered from COVID-19

daily.title: Daily Data
daily.description: New cases reported for a specific day

cumulative.title: Cumulative Data
cumulative.description: Total cases accumulated since the start of tracking

percentages.title: Percentages
percentages.description: Distribution of cases as percentage of total positive cases

serialInterval.title: Serial Interval
serialInterval.description: Time between symptom onset in successive cases in a chain of transmission

odp.description: Individuals who have been exposed to COVID-19 or have traveled from affected areas but show no symptoms. They are monitored for 14 days for potential symptom development.

pdp.description: Individuals showing COVID-19 symptoms (fever, cough, breathing difficulties) with a history of exposure or travel from affected areas. They require medical supervision and testing.

classificationProgression.title: Classification Progression
classificationProgression.description: Individuals may progress from ODP to PDP if symptoms develop, then receive testing for final diagnosis
